FAQ(s)

Here are some frequently asked questions (FAQs) regarding Greece’s participation in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris:

When will Greece compete in the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Greece is scheduled to compete from July 26 to August 11, 2024. The opening ceremony will take place on July 26, and events will be held across various venues in Paris and surrounding areas.

How many athletes will represent Greece?

Greece will have approximately 100 athletes competing across 16 sports at the Olympics, including a mix of men’s and women’s athletes.

What is unique about the 2024 Olympics?

The 2024 Summer Olympics will feature the first-ever opening ceremony held along the Seine River, showcasing a boat parade of athletes. Additionally, this edition of the Games marks the centenary of the 1924 Paris Olympics, making it a historic event.

What are the expectations for Greece’s performance?

Greece has a strong tradition in various sports, particularly in water polo and athletics. The team is expected to perform well, with hopes of securing medals in several events.
